<a id="CurveXYZTexture"></a>

# CurveXYZTexture

**Inherits:** [Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **\<** [Texture](Texture.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A 1D texture where the red, green, and blue color channels correspond to points on 3 curves.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A 1D texture where the red, green, and blue color channels correspond to points on 3 unit [Curve](Curve.md) resources. Compared to using separate [CurveTexture](CurveTexture.md)\\ s, this further simplifies the task of saving curves as image files.

If you only need to store one curve within a single texture, use [CurveTexture](CurveTexture.md) instead. See also [GradientTexture1D](GradientTexture1D.md) and [GradientTexture2D](GradientTexture2D.md).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_x"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Curve](Curve.md) **curve_x** [ðŸ”—](#CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_x)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_curve_x**\ (\ value\: [Curve](Curve.md)\ )
- [Curve](Curve.md) **get_curve_x**\ (\ )

The [Curve](Curve.md) that is rendered onto the texture's red channel. Should be a unit [Curve](Curve.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_y"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Curve](Curve.md) **curve_y** [ðŸ”—](#CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_y)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_curve_y**\ (\ value\: [Curve](Curve.md)\ )
- [Curve](Curve.md) **get_curve_y**\ (\ )

The [Curve](Curve.md) that is rendered onto the texture's green channel. Should be a unit [Curve](Curve.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_z"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Curve](Curve.md) **curve_z** [ðŸ”—](#CurveXYZTexture_property_curve_z)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_curve_z**\ (\ value\: [Curve](Curve.md)\ )
- [Curve](Curve.md) **get_curve_z**\ (\ )

The [Curve](Curve.md) that is rendered onto the texture's blue channel. Should be a unit [Curve](Curve.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CurveXYZTexture_property_width"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **width** = `256` [ðŸ”—](#CurveXYZTexture_property_width)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_width**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_width**\ (\ )

The width of the texture (in pixels). Higher values make it possible to represent high-frequency data better (such as sudden direction changes), at the cost of increased generation time and memory usage.
